intro: Jacquemontia gracilis, commonly known as the slender jacquemontia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, hairy stems that grow from 30 to 60 centimeters in height. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a distinctive hairy texture. Jacquemontia gracilis is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
